intro: Maba savaiiensis, commonly known as the Savaiean maba, is a flowering plant native to the island of Savai'i in Samoa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, green, and often waxy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is often found growing in coastal areas and lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
